es.unican.meteo.esgf.petition

Class CredentialsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.unican.meteo.esgf.petition.CredentialsManager

  • public class CredentialsManager
extends java.lang.Object

    Obtains from the user's openID an authenticated connection ( HttpURLConnection)for access to some ESGF url.

    Singleton class. Synchronized.

    Author:
    Karem Terry, Manuel Vega

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Get authenticated HttpURLConnection for the given URL.

      Get singleton instance of CredentialsManager.

      Get remaining time of certificate in milliseconds, after this time it will be invalid.

      Get X509Certificate credentials in file system (path: <user home folder>/.

      Initialize credential manager from local system files.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CredentialsManager getInstance()
        Get singleton instance of CredentialsManager. This instance is the only that exists.
        Returns:
        the unique instance of CredentialsManager.

      • getAuthenticatedConnection

        public java.net.HttpURLConnection getAuthenticatedConnection(java.net.URL url)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Get authenticated HttpURLConnection for the given URL. The returned connection is already opened.
        Parameters:
        url - ESGF file endpoint
        Returns:
        opened authenticated URL connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if happens some error trying to obtains authenticated connection
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CredentialManager hasn't been initiated

      • hasInitiated

        public boolean hasInitiated()
        Check if CredentialManager has been initiated.
        Returns:
        true if is configured and otherwise false.

      • renewFileCredentials

        public void renewFileCredentials()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Force to renew credentials an save them in local file system (path: <user home folder>/.[$ESG_HOME]/credentials.pem). Download credentials an save them in local files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error happens reading X509 certificate in file system
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CredentialManager hasn't been initiated or openID user hasn't configured

      • getX509Certificate

        public java.security.cert.X509Certificate getX509Certificate()
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Get X509Certificate credentials in file system (path: <user home folder>/.[$ESG_HOME]/credentials.pem) and return X509Certificate.

        If previously was read then it returned of memory

        Returns:
        X509Certificate credentials
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error happens reading X509 certificate in file system
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CredentialManager hasn't been initiated

      • getRemainTimeOfCredentialsInMillis

        public long getRemainTimeOfCredentialsInMillis()
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get remaining time of certificate in milliseconds, after this time it will be invalid.
        Returns:
        remaining time of certificate in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error happens reading X509 certificate in file system
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if CredentialManager hasn't been initiated

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String openIDURL,
              char[] password)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize credential manager with an openID. Synchronized. If previously has been initiated then reset all state of credential manager and reinitialize it.
        Parameters:
        openIDURL - OpenID-enabled URL that can be used to log into OpenID-enabled websites
        password - OpenID password
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some error happens getting credentials

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Initialize credential manager from local system files. (path: <user home folder>/.[$ESG_HOME]). Synchronized.
        Throws:
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if system local files certificates aren't valid
        java.io.IOException - if error happens reading file
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if previously has been initiated
